explanation: Agent A is correct. The statements “(void) connection; (void) nodelay_state;” in the #else branch are executed no-op expression statements that have no side effects; removing them would not change program behaviour. Per the quoted text of MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.2 (“Any operation that is executed but whose removal would not affect program behaviour constitutes dead code”), these statements qualify as dead code and therefore breach Rule 2.2. (If suppression of unused‑parameter warnings is required, the correct remedial action under MISRA would be to apply an accepted annotation/justification mechanism or alter the function signature/usage rather than leaving no‑op statements that constitute dead code.)
